bach_open_taxonomy.ModelHub.aggregate¶

property ModelHub.aggregate¶

Access aggregation methods from the model hub. Same as agg().

class Aggregate(df)

Models that return aggregated data in some form from the original ObjectivFrame.

Methods in this class can be filtered with the filter parameter, which always takes SeriesBoolean. The ModelHub can also create specific commonly used filters with methods that return SeriesBoolean from ModelHub.map.

Aggregate.frequency()

Calculate a frequency table for the number users by number of sessions.

Returns

series with results.

Aggregate.session_duration(groupby=NotSet.token)

Calculate the average duration of sessions.

Parameters

groupby –

sets the column(s) to group by.

  • if not_set it defaults to using ModelHub.time_agg.

  • if None it aggregates over all data.

Returns

series with results.

Aggregate.unique_sessions(filter=None, groupby=NotSet.token)

Calculate the unique sessions in the ObjectivFrame.

Parameters

  • filter – the output of this model is only based on the rows for which the filter is True.

  • groupby –

    sets the column(s) to group by.

    • if not_set it defaults to using ModelHub.time_agg.

    • if None it aggregates over all data.

Returns

series with results.

Aggregate.unique_users(filter=None, groupby=NotSet.token)

Calculate the unique users in the ObjectivFrame.

Parameters

  • filter – the output of this model is only based on the rows for which the filter is True.

  • groupby –

    sets the column(s) to group by.

    • if not_set it defaults to using ModelHub.time_agg.

    • if None it aggregates over all data.

Returns

series with results.
